message:
Guys, I need an answer fot that question: 

How to prevent/stop event bubbling/propagation on page load in asp.net
story: Ahmed Magdy shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: How to prevent/stop event bubbling/propagation on page load in asp.net - Stack Overflow
caption: stackoverflow.com

data.message: I liked your answer and appreciate your proposals for a  solution for preventing re-post after browser F. My problem is that that fix requires changes in the whole application, the approach  I took is a lot simpler in the time being. The point is that I have to do it manually in each page load to cleat the submit click event and what I'm looking for is something similar to jquery's e.stop.Propagation() but is seems hard to implement in asp.net :(
You can always redirect to the same URL, right?
I think this would be the easiest solution in your case, just redirect to the same URL in the check
The point is there are some pages that have multiple post backs to show and hide things, bind grid,... with redirect I have to pass some switches on the query string which costs some efforts
Note that you cannot stop CTRL+R or users selecting refresh from browser UI.
